metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:criteria element and all of its operators.

extend_definition.comment: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the AND operator
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the ONE operator
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the OR operator
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the XOR operator
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the negate attribute set to true
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with one level of nesting
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with two levels of nesting
Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with three levels of nesting

metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the AND operator
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:criteria element with the AND operator.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to AND where both criterion evaluate to true.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to true.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to AND where one criterion evaluates to true and one criterion evaluates to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to AND where two criterion evaluate to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to false.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the ONE operator
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:criteria element with the ONE operator.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to ONE where both criterion that evaluate to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to false.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to ONE where one criterion evaluates to true and one criterion evaluates to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to ONE where both criterion evaluate to true.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to true.

metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the OR operator
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:criteria element with the OR operator.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to OR where both criterion evaluate to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to false.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to OR where one criterion evaluates to true and one criterion evaluates to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to OR where both criterion evaluate to true.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to true.

metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the XOR operator
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:criteria element with the XOR operator.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to XOR where both criterion evaluate to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to false.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to XOR where one criterion evaluates to true and one criterion evaluates to false.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.

criteria.comment: Test that the criteria element is supported with the operator attribute set to XOR where both criterion evaluate to true.

metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with the negate attribute set to true
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:criteria element with the negate attribute set to true.

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to false.

metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:criteria element is properly supported with one level of nesting
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports one level of nested oval-def:criteria elements.

notes.note: XOR ( AND ( T ) , ONE ( T , T , T ) , OR ( F , F ) ) = T

criterion.comment: This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to true.
This test is intended to evaluate to false.

metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports two levels of nested oval-def:criteria elements.

notes.note: OR ( AND ( T , T , XOR ( T , F ) ) , ONE ( AND ( T ) , ONE ( T , F ) , F ) ) = T

metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports three levels of nested oval-def:criteria elements.

notes.note: XOR ( AND ( T , T , XOR ( T , XOR ( F ) , F ) ) , ONE ( AND ( T ) , ONE ( OR ( T , F , F ) , F , F ) , F ) ) = T

variable_object.comment: This variable_object references the boolean value 'true'.
